messages.message: Hi all, is there any plans to upgrade `protobuf` in python layer? I just learned that `MessageToDict` automatically converts all numerical proto fields to strings in the dict object that gets returned. There's a parameter called `use_integers_for_enums` that we can pass, but I don't think it's supported on our version of `protobuf`

It does that for int64 only because there is not enough precision in a JSON number (64-bit float) to encode those. I doubt upgrading will fix that.

If you want numbers in the JSON, use an int32 in the protobuf.

You can also use BigInt on the JS side to parse the 64-bit number strings.
That said, upgrading proto is a good idea anyway!!
Makes sense! I looked into the documentation a bit more `use_integers_for_enums`  won't help us for that case
